translation.en: ♪ BLACKPINK… ♪
[Michael Strahan in English] Our next guests are the best-charting female Korean group of all time.
translation.ko: 역대 최고 차트 성적을 자랑하는 한국 여성 그룹입니다

translation.en: …wildly popular K-pop group…
K-pop sensations, BLACKPINK!
[reporter 1] BLACKPINK has become
the highest charting K-pop girl group ever.
translation.ko: 역대 케이 팝 걸 그룹 최고 차트 성적을 기록했습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] They also made history as they became
the first K-pop girl group to perform at Coachella.
[host 3] Performing it live for the first time ever on US television,
translation.ko: 미국 텔레비전에서 최초 라이브 공연을 선보입니다

translation.en: here is BLACKPINK!
-[host 4] BLACKPINK! -BLACKPINK!
-[Lisa] I'm so hungry. -[Jennie] Are you?
-Did I eat something today? -[Lisa] No.
There's a dessert. It's like a croissant with injeolmi.
translation.ko: 디저트가 있어요 인절미 크루아상 같은 거예요

translation.en: You guys don't like injeolmi?
It tastes really good. [giggles]
[Jennie] Every time a new album comes, we're just excited. We're like,
"Ah, yay. Finally, one more," you know?
I think we're halfway there, maybe?
translation.ko: 우리가 한 중간쯤 온 것 같달까?

translation.en: We're always halfway there. We're like, "We have the songs…
there. We just need to record them."
[in English] It's time for us to do some music. Yeah.
[Jennie] We just have so much to show people.
I don't think we've done something really girly yet.
translation.ko: 엄청 소녀소녀한 건 아직 안 했던 것 같아요

translation.en: We've practiced and explored so many different things,
um, during our trainee days,
and so it's just a matter of how much of that we could end up showing
translation.ko: 그러니까 블랙핑크로서 얼마나 보여줄 수 있는지가

translation.en: as BLACKPINK.
I think, for me, when I say girly, I want to do more like…
translation.ko: 소녀소녀라는 말은 이런 게 하고 싶단 거였어

translation.en: like… [softly] "Hello…"
-[all giggle] -[Rosé] Like what?
[in English] I'm their producer, songwriter.
I've written and produced every single song that's come out so far.
translation.ko: 지금까지 나온 곡은 전부 제가 작곡하고 제작했죠

translation.en: It's been about four years now.
Our initial approach was more like…
translation.ko: "테디 박 프로듀서/작곡가" 우리 초기 접근 방식은

translation.en: single, smash, single, hit.
translation.ko: 싱글 앨범을 하나씩 내서 대박을 터뜨리는 거였죠

translation.en: Now, we feel like we need to tell more of our personal story.
translation.ko: 이제 사적인 얘기를 더 해야겠단 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: And I know the fans are mad. Like, "We want more and more."
translation.ko: 팬들이 화난 거 알아요 더 많은 걸 원하시죠

translation.en: We do have a lot in here, but…
we're very particular with what we put out.
[Jennie in English] Oppa, you got some leather jackets going on there?
[in Korean] Awesome!
[in English] Stop acting like I overdressed today.
translation.ko: 오늘 내가 오버한 것처럼 굴지 마

translation.en: I always dress like this.
[Teddy in English] So, I have the…
Lady Gaga featuring BLACKPINK that's about to come out.
translation.ko: 블랙핑크 피처링 레이디 가가 노래가 있어

translation.en: We worked hard before New Year's for this.
translation.ko: 이것 때문에 새해 전에 열심히 일했잖아요

translation.en: [Teddy] They're huge, and they're so successful.
I don't think any of us even expected this.
Sometimes it gets to me, like, "Oh, my God."
How do we live up to this hype?
Sour candy. [laughs]
[Teddy in Korean] Should we re-record certain parts of "Crazy Over You"?
[Teddy in English] Every group has their own different cultural background
that makes them who they are.
[Teddy] But the combination, that's what makes BLACKPINK unique
and stand out.
[in English] Rosé, want to go in first for the intro?
[Teddy] Rosé, a Korean girl that was raised in Australia.
And she stays here 'til, like, six o'clock a.m. just in the studio.
Sometimes I'm like, "Wow! You still here?"
[in English] Ooh… you really killed that one.
[Teddy] Jisoo. Straight-up Korean girl that grew up in Korea.
She's the unnie of the group. She's the oldest.
[Teddy] She does have that professional poker face.
I've known Jisoo for, let's say, a good six years.
I've seen her cry…
once.
She's super smart.
A lot of people might think she's book smart,
but I would say she's street smart.
[Teddy in English] Lisa, from Thailand.
She's always got that cool, calm, "it's gonna be okay, we're all good" smile.
translation.ko: 항상 차분하고, 침착하며 다 괜찮을 거라는 미소를 지어요

translation.en: [Teddy] But when it comes to certain moments,
when the music starts, when it's crunch time,
translation.ko: 음악이 시작될 때나 마감일이 임박할 때면

translation.en: she has this executioner killer instinct.
translation.ko: 사형 집행인 같은 킬러 본능이 나옵니다

translation.en: [Teddy in English] Jennie, born in Korea, but moved to New Zealand.
translation.ko: 제니는 한국에서 태어나서 뉴질랜드로 유학 간 멤버예요

translation.en: She's super clear.
Her opinions, her emotions.
She's a perfectionist.
[Teddy] All those different cultures in one pot,
it's just different how they walk, how they talk, and how they dress.
translation.ko: 걷는 것도, 말하는 것도 입는 것도 다른데

translation.en: And the perfect balance, how they complement each other.
It's fascinating.
[Teddy] We're just Korean people trying to do music,
so if Korean people make music,
translation.ko: 한국인이 만든 음악은 전부 케이 팝인가요?

translation.en: it's K-pop? I don't even get it. Like…
translation.ko: 한국인이 만든 음악은 전부 케이 팝인가요? 이해가 안 돼요

translation.en: It's Korean pop.
The only thing is language.
Why don't they do that for every country?
What is K-pop?
-[static] -K-pop.
[reporter 1] K-pop is taking the US by storm.
K-pop has become a worldwide cultural phenomenon.
translation.ko: 케이 팝은 세계적 문화 현상이 됐습니다

translation.en: The genre has been around for at least two decades.
[in Korean] This is a three-member group named Seo Taiji and Boys.
[reporter 3 in English] A few big music agencies began making these polished groups
translation.ko: 주요 음악 기획사들이 세련된 그룹을 내기 시작했습니다

translation.en: of singers, rappers, and dancers.
[reporter 4] One of the heavy-weight companies is YG Entertainment.
translation.ko: 업계 대형 기획사로는 YG 엔터테인먼트가 있습니다

translation.en: [reporter 5] …responsible for the insanely viral "Gangnam Style."
[reporter 5 in English] The industry brings in billions of dollars a year.
translation.ko: 케이 팝 업계는 매년 수십억 달러를 벌어들입니다

translation.en: [reporter 6] Grooming these singers is an industry all in itself.
translation.ko: 가수들을 가꾸는 일이 업계 그 자체예요

translation.en: [reporter 7] Trainees can start as young as 11 years old.
[reporter 8] They're raised together. They train together.
[reporter 9] Perfecting every pitch. Mastering every move.
[reporter 7] Stakes are high. Some make their debut after just a few months' training.
translation.ko: 위험 부담이 커요 몇 달 만에 데뷔하기도 하지만

translation.en: For others, it could be up to a decade. Many never make it to debut at all.
translation.ko: 10년이 걸리기도 하죠 대다수 연습생은 데뷔를 못 합니다

translation.en: [Jennie in English] Preparing for a new album, that's definitely fun,
'cause it's like trying to come up with something new,
but fittings like this,
it is one of the biggest, like, creative parts that we do.
translation.ko: 우리 창의력이 가장 많이 들어가는 한 부분이에요

translation.en: [in English] It takes a long time.
[in English] Okay.
[Jennie] Lisa! Lalisa!
-[in English] She can wear whatever. -She pulls off anything.
translation.ko: - 원하는 건 뭐든 입을 수 있죠 - 맞아, 다 잘 어울려

translation.en: [Rosé] It's so hard to define style.
I don't think there's any, like, boundaries within that.
We don't go, "This is Korean, and this is Western. This is Asian."
translation.ko: 한국 것, 서양 것, 동양 것 구분 짓지 않죠

translation.en: I think fashion is really just international.
The more that there aren't any boundaries, I think that's when you can get creative.
translation.ko: 경계가 없을수록 창의력을 발휘할 수 있어요

translation.en: And since we do crazy choreography on stage,
it all has to be really engineered, basically.
Make sure nothing flops out anywhere.
-[Rosé] Yeah. -[laughs]
[in English] Yeah. If anything, it's stressful.
Sometimes if something's not working, or I'm not doing my best performance,
translation.ko: 뭐가 제대로 안 되거나 최고의 기량을 못 보이면

translation.en: it can be stressful.
-This is it. -This is it.
I always avoid interviews or any questions about me
translation.ko: 저에 관해서 묻는 인터뷰는 늘 피했어요

translation.en: because I would rather not talk about myself, but…
[Jennie in English] She's my friend. One of few that I have.
[in English] I'm always aching after tours and stuff.
I feel like, out of all the members, I'm always sick. [laughs]
translation.ko: 멤버들 중에서 제가 항상 아픈 것 같아요

translation.en: You know, some days, just like every other human being,
you feel extra happy.
And some other days, you're feeling down.
Singing, dancing, and rapping, I always enjoy it all the time,
translation.ko: 노래하고 춤추고 랩 하는 걸 항상 즐기긴 하지만

translation.en: but we always have to be on stage
looking perfect and performing the same thing.
translation.ko: 완벽해 보여야 하고 똑같은 걸 공연해야 해요

translation.en: It's like working out for two hours every day.
It never gets easy.
Gets harder, actually, 'cause you age. [laughs]
I was born in Korea.
It's just me and my mom. I'm the only child.
translation.ko: 가족은 엄마랑 저 둘뿐이고 전 외동이에요

translation.en: I was raised in Seoul until I was ten.
I went to Australia and New Zealand to travel with my mom,
and by the time we got to New Zealand,
it was so nice and peaceful.
She asked me, "How do you feel about living here?"
And I said, "Yeah, I would like that."
So, from ten to 15, I was in New Zealand by myself.
I never really got to spend so much time in the house with my mom…
translation.ko: 엄마랑 집에서 많은 시간을 보내지 못했죠

translation.en: until recently.
[Jennie] I did a homestay.
I got to just run around, learn so many things.
translation.ko: 그냥 뛰어다니면서 많은 걸 배울 수 있었죠

translation.en: [Jennie in English] They have classes in school to go out,
go camping, go learn instruments. If you want, do art.
translation.ko: 캠핑도 가고, 악기도 배우고 원하면 미술 수업도 받아요

translation.en: Everything was up to you.
Even if you're ten, you still got to make your own decisions.
That was very important for me to have at a young age.
That built me as who I am right now.
I am super shy.
I was one of those people where I can't even order something on the phone.
translation.ko: 전화로 주문도 못 하는 그런 사람이었어요

translation.en: Like, I hated that.
[Jennie in English] Took me a while to get this far.
[Jennie] When I turned 15, I was deciding whether I should move to America.
I went there, I checked the school out. Everything was kind of decided, like 80%.
And I came back to New Zealand to pack my stuff up,
and that's when I realized I don't want to go to America
and do another study there by myself.
I actually want to become a singer. I don't know where it came from.
translation.ko: 사실 가수가 되고 싶었어요 어쩌다 그 생각이 들었는지 몰라요

translation.en: [Jennie] As soon as I came back, I did an audition. And luckily, I got in right away.
translation.ko: 한국에 오자마자 오디션을 봤고 운 좋게도 바로 붙었어요

translation.en: I was like, "Wow! These people are so in to it!"
"They know what they're doing." I was like, "Let's catch up."
That's all I had in mind.
♪ I only call you When it's half past five ♪ ♪ The only time that I can call you… ♪
[Jennie in English] It's sad to say, the very first group of people that trained with me,
translation.ko: 안타깝지만 저랑 처음 같이 있었던 연습생들은

translation.en: none of them are here with me right now.
And as soon as Lisa came in, that's when I thought…
translation.ko: 그러다 리사가 들어오자 그 생각을 하게 됐어요

translation.en: [in English] Oh, this is cute.
[in English] Oh, wow. Voilà!
[in English] This is so cool!
Can I-- Can I get this? [chuckles]
[in English] She's gonna be like, "No, Lisa, no. Stop shopping for now."
translation.ko: 엄마는 이러시고요 '리사, 안 돼, 쇼핑 그만해'

translation.en: She's always like that, but I don't really listen to her.
translation.ko: 늘 그렇게 말씀하시는데 전 엄마 말 안 들어요

translation.en: I'm sorry, Mom. [giggles]
When I was born.
[in Thai] I was born in Buriram Province.
Then I moved to Bangkok when I was three.
My auntie had a music group,
so they had mic stands, and I always played with them.
translation.ko: 마이크 스탠드가 있었는데 전 늘 그걸 가지고 놀았어요

translation.en: I would lower it until it was the same height as me.
translation.ko: 제 키만 해질 때까지 내린 다음에

translation.en: Then I would just dance and sing to myself.
That was how my mom knew I loved dancing.
translation.ko: 엄마는 그걸 보고 제가 춤을 좋아한단 걸 알았죠

translation.en: So she signed me up for a course when I was in kindergarten.
[Lisa] That was how it all began.
[Lisa] She signed me up to many contests…
[in English] …dance competition and stuff.
[in Thai] How long have you been practicing break dancing?
For a long time.
[Lisa] I participated in a contest. I was around 12 or 13 years old then.
Then a talent scout told me to try singing and asked if I wanted to be a singer.
translation.ko: 스카우터가 노래를 불러보라면서 가수가 되고 싶냐고 물어봤어요

translation.en: Then I realized that I loved both singing and dancing.
translation.ko: 제가 노래랑 춤을 다 좋아한단 걸 그때 알게 됐죠

translation.en: And YG happened to have an audition at the time.
So, I made a decision.
[in English] Okay. I should try, for sure.
[in Thai] After the audition ended… [in Korean] …I waited for the call.
[in Thai] I waited for the call.
I waited for two months!
And then they called me. I was like, "What? Is this possible?"
translation.ko: 연락이 오자 전 이렇게 반응했죠 '네? 이거 진짜예요?'

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] I was a mama's girl.
So, when I had to go to Korea without Mom,
translation.ko: 그래서 엄마 없이 한국에 가게 되자

translation.en: I felt that I had to take care of myself now.
translation.ko: 이제 혼자 앞가림을 해야 하는구나 싶었어요

translation.en: [in English] I was 14.
Such a kid.
[in English] ♪ I'm in the club High off purp', with some shades on… ♪
[in English] However you feel comfortable. Like…
-[Teddy] There you go. -Okay.
[Teddy] That's cool. I'm happy with that.
[Jisoo] What's up? What's up?
I think it’ll be nice to learn how to draw my eyebrows properly.
[Rosé in English] I have a really hard time falling asleep.
I have a lot of thoughts running through my head.
And singing is kind of like stress relief,
and everything just kind of makes sense when I'm doing this.
translation.ko: 노래할 때면 모든 게 제자리로 돌아가요

translation.en: I didn't think I could ever perfect that one. [laughs]
translation.ko: 완벽하게 부를 수 있을 것 같진 않았어요

translation.en: Sometimes, I actually have missed my trainee days.
translation.ko: 사실 연습생 시절이 그리울 때도 있어요

translation.en: Because, back then, we were surrounded by music all the time.
translation.ko: 그때 우리는 항상 음악에 둘러싸여 있었거든요

translation.en: But these days we've got a lot of work,
so I actually have to make time for this.
That's why it's always at night, when I'm supposed to be sleeping.
translation.ko: 그래서 항상 잘 시간인 밤에 부르는 거예요

translation.en: Hi, girls and boys.
I'm called Roseanne…
and I just woke up.
And welcome to Pajama News.
[Rosé] I was born in New Zealand.
And then I moved to Australia when I was eight.
Back then, I was always on the piano.
I'd like sit there, and I'd play this lullaby for myself,
but I'd be really sleepy, and I'd fall asleep,
and then I'd put my chin on my knee.
I went to church every Sunday and had a lot of Korean friends there.
translation.ko: 일요일마다 교회에 가서 한국인 친구들을 많이 사귀었지만

translation.en: But then at school, I was just a normal Australian kid.
-[man] Congratulations, Rosé. -[audience clapping]
[Rosé] And I think I enjoyed having two lives.
translation.ko: 두 가지 삶을 사는 게 즐거웠어요

translation.en: Kind of like Hannah Montana. [laughs]
It's funny.
[Rosé] My dad saw on the news that YG was coming to Australia.
translation.ko: YG가 호주에 온다는 소식을 아빠가 보시고

translation.en: He was like, "Rosé, do you wanna audition?"
And I was so shocked.
I think I asked him, "Do I like music? Do I?"
translation.ko: 아빠에게 물어봤던 것 같아요 '나 음악 좋아해? 내가?'

translation.en: And he's like, "Yeah, obviously."
"You're gonna have to, you know, try do something about it."
"Otherwise you're gonna be 25,
and you're gonna regret that you didn't try anything."
[Rosé] I was 16.
Then I went and auditioned, and then they called me,
and they were like, "Can you fly to Korea within two months?"
translation.ko: 2개월 내로 한국에 올 수 있냐고 했어요

translation.en: [Rosé] And then my whole life changed.
I dropped out of school.
In Australia, I dropped out of school.
I had never even imagined myself living apart from my family.
translation.ko: 가족과 떨어져 사는 삶은 상상도 못 했어요

translation.en: I hadn't even slept more than two weeks out of home.
translation.ko: 집이 아닌 곳에서 2주 이상 자본 적도 없었죠

translation.en: It was a really-- Oh, my gosh. I'm gonna cry.
I'm gonna cry.
Yeah.
The first night in the dorm,
they were all in the same room.
Everybody was sleeping.
[in English] It was us four. I don't even know why,
but it was us four.
We covered songs 'til morning.
All four of us, we were singing. Somebody was harmonizing.
translation.ko: 넷이서 같이 불렀어요 누군가는 화음을 넣어주고요

translation.en: I think Jisoo was harmonizing.
It was so funny. Can you believe it?
-[Rosé laughs] -My eyes.
[Rosé] My eyes.
[in English] One, two…
-Nice. -I wanna have a look.
-[Rosé laughs] -I was like… so wary of competition.
[in English] Everything was gyeongjaeng at that time.
She thought I was competition, and I was just really intimidated.
translation.ko: 리사는 저를 경쟁 상대로 봤대요 전 엄청 주눅 들어 있었는데요

translation.en: Like, everybody is so good.
[Lisa in Thai] We were the same age,
and we had similar tastes.
[in Thai] We become like two peas in a pod.
We were like genuine twins.
[Rosé in English] We have so many days where we walk out, and we're wearing the same thing.
translation.ko: 밖에 나와서 보면 같은 옷을 입은 날이 많아요

translation.en: [in English] She started getting an Australian accent.
See, she still has it sometimes.
[in Australian accent] No.
-Yeah. -No.
[giggles] I don't even know how to say--
I never knew I would live in Korea.
Then all of a sudden at 16, I'm like…
Now Korea is my home.
[in English] Of course.
Even though you have me?
You?
You're not any help.
I'm joking. [giggles]
-Yeah, 'cause I grew up with a sister. -Mm.
Think about not having a sister.
But Lisa was there.
[in English] I thought I was really sad, but I'd look at you, and I'd go, "Okay."
translation.ko: 정말 슬프다 싶은 순간 널 보면 위안이 됐어

translation.en: I think what makes K-pop K-pop is the time that we spend as a trainee.
translation.ko: 케이 팝을 케이 팝으로 만드는 건 연습생으로 보내는 시간이라고 생각해요

translation.en: We all live together, sort of like a boarding school,
translation.ko: "연습생 기간 6년, 5년, 4년, 5년" 우리는 기숙 학교 연습생 버전처럼

translation.en: like a training version.
[Rosé] I think there were nine girls.
They were planning on creating a big group,
so they had a lot of girls there.
[Jennie] They need you to be at their standard in every single subject.
translation.ko: 모든 부문에서 회사 기준에 부합해야 해요

translation.en: [Rosé in English] We'd get a day off every fortnight,
and then practice again for another 13 days.
So 14 hours a day just training. [chuckles]
[Teddy] It's not easy,
the repetition.
But at such a young age, they are able to absorb all the techniques and the tools
translation.ko: 하지만 그렇게 어린 나이에 블랙핑크는 향후 10년간 필요한

translation.en: that they need for their next ten years.
translation.ko: 모든 기술과 수단을 흡수할 수 있었어요

translation.en: [Rosé] There's this basic routine you have to learn in dancing.
translation.ko: 춤에서 배워야 하는 기본 루틴이 있어요

translation.en: Jennie was like, "The first thing you have to learn is that,
translation.ko: 제니 언니가 그랬죠 '처음 배워야 하는 건 그거야'

translation.en: and I'll just teach you the first moves."
And she was like, "Do this." And I was like, "I don't know how."
[Lisa] I can still remember the first day that you had a dance lesson.
translation.ko: 네가 댄스 레슨 처음 받은 날 지금도 기억나

translation.en: -[laughs] -'Cause I'd never danced in my life.
It was cute.
If you ask a 16-year-old to dance for the first time,
it's the funniest thing. I looked like a…
And then after that, I got so angry at myself.
translation.ko: 그러고 나서 나한테 너무 화가 났어

translation.en: I was like, "I am going to become like Lisa."
'Cause Lisa was the dancer. She was like… She was at the top.
[Rosé] At the end of every month, our boss and all the producers would come,
and we'd perform a solo song, a group song, and a group choreography.
translation.ko: 저희는 솔로 곡, 그룹 곡 그룹 안무를 선보였어요

translation.en: [Jennie in English] I remember having to send a good friend of mine home every month
translation.ko: 매달 친구들을 집으로 보내야 했던 기억이 나요

translation.en: because they got eliminated from the test.
There were so many rules, so many things to just be like,
translation.ko: 규칙이 정말 많았고 파악할 것도 많았어요

translation.en: "Okay, they don't like this. They don't like that."
Everything that I did was wrong.
[Jennie] Being told that I'm not good at stuff face-to-face
and trying to keep everything together when I hear those things…
translation.ko: 그런 말을 들으면서도 침착함을 유지하려고 하는 건…

translation.en: It's really harsh.
It wasn't a very happy vibe.
We're not allowed to drink, or smoke, or get a tattoo.
translation.ko: 술도, 담배도, 문신도 하면 안 돼요

translation.en: …and I would always call her and tell her, "Mom, it's so hard."
She'd say, "Come home." I'd say, "No."
translation.ko: 엄마가 집에 오라고 하면 싫다고 했고요

translation.en: My dad sent me, and he was like, "Rosé, come home."
translation.ko: 아빠는 절 보내놓고 그랬어요 '로제, 집에 와'

translation.en: He's like, "We want you back home."
And I hated that. I hated it whenever they would say, "Come home."
That was the last thing I wanted to hear.
[Jennie] I don't regret spending time as a trainee, learning how to dance, how to sing.
translation.ko: 춤과 노래를 배우면서 연습생으로 산 건 후회 안 하는데

translation.en: But one thing I wish is to maybe have lived at home
translation.ko: 집에서 살았으면 어땠을까 그거 하나는 바라게 되더라고요

translation.en: until I was like 18, 19.
A lot of people make lots of memories as a high school student.
translation.ko: 많은 사람이 고등학생 때 추억을 잔뜩 쌓죠

translation.en: But I never had that.
[in Thai] I didn't think I would make it. I was on the verge of letting it go.
translation.ko: 해낼 거라고 생각 안 했어요 포기하기 직전이었죠

translation.en: [in English] It was just days on end with just a bunch of girls not knowing where this was going.
translation.ko: 앞날도 모른 채 여자애들 몇 명과 날마다 같이 있었던 거죠

translation.en: [Jennie in English] I knew I could do it.
translation.ko: 내가 할 수 있다는 건 알았어요

translation.en: The tougher they treated me,
I'm like, "I'm gonna get through it,
and I'm gonna show them that I'm worth it."
[Rosé] After all of this,
I'm not gonna go back without doing anything.
translation.ko: 한 것도 없이 돌아가진 않을 거예요

translation.en: That would be embarrassing for me. That's what I thought.
[Lisa in Thai] I had to keep fighting. I had to give it my all.
translation.ko: 전 계속 싸워야 했어요 제 모든 걸 바쳐야 했고요

translation.en: "I don't care how long the training will take."
"Bring it on! I don't care about that anymore!"
translation.ko: '어디 해봐 난 이제 신경 안 쓰니까'

translation.en: [Jennie in English] So, the CEO would put us
translation.ko: 사장님은 저희를 두 달에 한 번 다른 그룹들에 넣었어요

translation.en: into different groups every other month just to see.
translation.ko: 사장님은 저희를 두 달에 한 번 다른 그룹들에 넣었어요 어떤지 보려고요

translation.en: And there was a point where he pointed the four of us out.
translation.ko: 그러다 저희 넷을 뽑은 때가 왔죠

translation.en: [Jennie] We just got along so well.
Because usually there's like, "Oh, I wanna sing more."
translation.ko: 보통 노래 파트를 더 가져가려고 하거나

translation.en: Or, "Oh, I wanna be in the middle."
There's always those little fights going on in the groups.
translation.ko: 그룹에선 늘 그런 작은 다툼이 일어나는데

translation.en: But when it was the four of us, it was clear what we were doing.
And that's what made it possible for us to be in a group.
translation.ko: 그래서 우리가 한 그룹이 되는 게 가능했죠

translation.en: You know, four girls being in one group is not easy.
translation.ko: 여자 넷이 한 그룹을 하는 건 쉽지 않거든요

translation.en: [Teddy] When I first came in the picture, there were seven, eight, nine girls.
translation.ko: 제가 처음 들어왔을 때만 해도 여자애들이 7, 8, 9명 있었어요

translation.en: Then we started cutting some songs,
and sonically, whatever that sounded the best.
The four girls right now, the combination.
And of course you start looking at their individuality, like their character.
translation.ko: 물론 각자의 개성과 성격도 보게 되죠

translation.en: The four of them just felt right.
[Teddy in English] It's a different time,
and I just wanted to become someone that I needed when I was young.
translation.ko: 어렸을 때 제게 필요했던 그런 사람이 되고 싶었어요

translation.en: I didn't have somebody that's a little more outside looking in,
translation.ko: 바깥에서 바라보며 어디로 갈지 알려주는 사람이

translation.en: telling me where to go.
[in English] I was so nervous. I couldn't really talk to him.
translation.ko: 너무 긴장했어요 얘기도 제대로 할 수 없었죠

translation.en: -[in English] That I'll never forget. -[girls laughing]
I cannot forget that.
And we almost didn't come out with "Whistle" for our debut song, but--
[Teddy] Too many people thought it was risky.
But last minute, we were like, "It has to be that one."
[Teddy] 'Cause it has this weird country vibe to it, and it's super minimal.
translation.ko: 이상한 컨트리 느낌이 있고 엄청 미니멀해서

translation.en: It just sounded too empty for a lot of people.
translation.ko: 많은 사람에겐 너무 빈 것처럼 들렸어요

translation.en: Most people were against it. We just pushed forward, whatever.
Hey, you know that photo there?
That's our very first photo session as BLACKPINK.
[Jennie] Yeah.
It's oppa's favorite photo.
As soon as I saw that photo, how it turned out, I was like,
translation.ko: 저 사진이 어떻게 나왔나 딱 보자마자 생각했어요

translation.en: "Oh, this is gonna be fun."
to showcase its first new girl group in seven years since 2NE1 debuted.
[in English] All I wanted was people to see the potential in us.
It didn't necessarily have to be, "Wow! This group came out,
translation.ko: 이런 반응이 아니어도 괜찮았어요 '와, 이번에 나온 그룹 모든 면에서 완벽하다'

translation.en: and they're so perfect in every single way."
translation.ko: '와, 이번에 나온 그룹 모든 면에서 완벽하다'

translation.en: Like, I wanted people to be curious about us.
[in English] As soon as we debuted…
[in English] Let's go!
[in English] I remember we were…
[in English] We jumped up and down.
[in English] Lisa! I love you!
[fan 1] I just really like their style.
Their sound is super different from other K-pop groups.
translation.ko: 다른 케이 팝 그룹과는 사운드가 완전 달라요

translation.en: [fan 2] It's 'cause they have so many foreign members,
and it really shows how anyone can achieve their dreams.
translation.ko: 누구나 꿈을 이룰 수 있단 걸 보여주죠

translation.en: [fan 3] They own the stage when they're on it.
[in Dutch] When their music is played, you just instantly start dancing.
translation.ko: 음악이 시작되면 바로 춤을 추게 돼요

translation.en: [in English] They have the strongest friendship I've seen in a K-pop group.
translation.ko: 가장 우정이 돈독한 케이 팝 그룹이에요

translation.en: [in Spanish] You can see they love what they are doing and are born to do it.
translation.ko: 자기 일을 즐기고 그 일에 타고났어요

translation.en: [in English] I felt like this is a girl group that I can actually vibe with.
translation.ko: 이 걸 그룹이야말로 내가 즐길 수 있는 그룹 같았어요

translation.en: [in English] You know, they cool.
They the baddest bitches alive. [laughs]
[Lisa in Thai] When I was a trainee, nobody knew about me.
But after I debuted as BLACKPINK,
everyone would follow me no matter where I went.
translation.ko: 제가 어디를 가든 모두 절 따라다녀요

translation.en: I didn't know that we would become this famous.
[Rosé in English] How much did you sleep last night?
-[in English] Three hours? -Yup.
[Rosé in English] During trainee days, I was desperate. I really wanted it.
But after debut, that's when you start getting a lot of responsibilities.
translation.ko: 하지만 데뷔하고 나니 책임이 커지기 시작했어요

translation.en: [director in English] Action!
[reporter 1 in English] It's a big day for BLACKPINK
as "Ddu-Du Ddu-Du" has become the most viewed Korean music video in 24 hours.
translation.ko: '뚜두뚜두'가 한국 뮤직비디오 최다 24시간 조회 수를 기록했죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] Three music videos with over 400 million views.
[reporter 3] One billion views on YouTube.
[Rosé] I think when things get faster,
it also becomes very overwhelming at some points.
[inhales] Yeah.
[Lisa in Thai] I still remember the first time…
[Lisa] I went back to Thailand after my debut.
Because Thai teens see me as a Thai who has made it this far.
They would say, "I want to be like Lisa."
[crowd chanting] Lisa!
WELCOME HOME LISA WE MISSED YOU
[Lisa in Thai] But at that moment,
translation.ko: 하지만 그 당시에 저는 확신이 없었어요

translation.en: I wasn't sure if I was really good enough to be their role model.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 당시에 저는 확신이 없었어요 제가 롤 모델이 될 만한 사람인지요

translation.en: [in Thai] Could I really become their role model?
translation.ko: '내가 진짜로 롤 모델이 될 수 있을까?'

translation.en: What should I do to not let them down?
These kinds of thoughts kept running through my mind.
[Jennie in English] We need sugar. [in singsong voice] We need sugar.
-[Jisoo] One spoon. -One spoon.
[in English] This is actually a Chinese traditional snack,
but it's hard to find it here in Korea.
[Jennie in English] This is a way of me teaching Jisoo to speak English.
translation.ko: 제가 지수 언니에게 영어를 가르치는 방법이에요

translation.en: She got better in the last six months.
She understands everything that I say, so I do talk to her in English sometimes.
translation.ko: 제가 하는 말을 다 이해해서 언니에게 영어로 말하기도 해요

translation.en: [in English] Not bad.
Not bad but not good.
Yeah. Let's be honest. It was a fail. Yes.
[in English] In Korea, one of the first things you ask, other than your name, is how old are you?
translation.ko: 한국에서 이름을 제외하고 제일 먼저 묻는 건 나이예요

translation.en: And as soon as they say they're older, it's like, "Oh, you're unnie."
So, unnie is basically what you call an older sister.
translation.ko: '언니'는 연상의 여자 형제를 부를 때 쓰는 호칭이에요

translation.en: It's like--
[in English] We don't call each other by names.
It's normally unnie if you're older than me, and oppa if you're a guy.
It takes a while to get used to, but once you get a hold of it,
translation.ko: 익숙해지는 데 좀 걸리지만 한번 적응하면

translation.en: it's better than calling their names.
She's not Jisoo. She's unnie.
It's like family, in a way.
[in English] It's okay, actually. I could eat this.
[in Korean] Semi-success.
[man in English] Okay. It's just Rosé and the beat.
-Oh, my God! -No words, no melody whatsoever.
[man] So here we go.
[Rosé] You know how when people say they're afraid of heights
or they're afraid of water?
I've always been so afraid of getting in the studio or writing something.
translation.ko: 전 스튜디오에 들어가거나 뭔가를 쓰는 게 늘 무서웠어요

translation.en: I always thought just someday I have to just start it. I have to.
translation.ko: 언젠가는 그냥 시작해야 한다고 늘 생각했어요, 해야만 하죠

translation.en: -I'm gonna still keep this one. -Okay.
-Let's try one more time. -Okay.
Do I change the rhythm? I keep going for the same thing.
-Do you feel uncomfortable singing it? -Do I feel uncomfortable singing it?
Like slightly. Maybe I'll try singing it one more time.
translation.ko: 조금요, 한 번 더 해볼까 봐요

translation.en: I've seen Joe a few times, and his music's like amazing.
translation.ko: 조는 몇 번 봤어요 조의 음악은 훌륭하죠

translation.en: I was just like, to Teddy, "What do you think if he helps me out?"
translation.ko: 제가 테디한테 제안했어요 '조가 저를 도와주면 어때요?'

translation.en: So here's what we worked on. This is Rosé's first recorded song.
translation.ko: 이게 저희가 작업한 거예요 로제의 첫 녹음 곡이죠

translation.en: [Rosé] We even saved this whole file in this secret folder
because I said nobody can listen to it. I was like, "Hide it from everyone."
translation.ko: 제가 아무도 못 듣는다고 했거든요 모두한테서 숨기라고 했죠

translation.en: When it comes to writing songs, Rosé has certain stories in mind.
translation.ko: 로제는 노래를 쓸 때 머리에 이야기가 있는데

translation.en: And she's shy about sharing that story. It's just super personal to her.
translation.ko: 그 얘기를 나누는 걸 부끄러워해요 로제에게 아주 사적인 거라서요

translation.en: It's like her diary.
[Rosé laughs] Oh, my gosh!
You sounded nervous in that one.
Yeah. I'm like, "I don't know what I'm doing." [giggles]
I was thinking it'd be fun if I write something like…
translation.ko: 생각해봤는데 이런 걸 쓰면 재밌을 것 같아요

translation.en: [in English] Teddy told me yesterday too.
He was like, "You need to learn how to be more vulnerable in the studio."
translation.ko: '넌 스튜디오에서 더 약해지는 법을 배워야 해'

translation.en: That's something I can't do too easily, but I was gonna say--
translation.ko: 제가 쉽게 못 하는 일이에요 하지만 하려던 말은…

translation.en: -[Joe] I mean, it takes time. -Yeah.
I really have a lot of respect for music,
so I don't wanna be just like another girl who sings
translation.ko: 그러니 노래 부르면서 남들에게 곡 쓴다고 말하고 다니는

translation.en: and just kind of tells everybody that she writes music.
That's the last thing I wanna be.
-Whoa, I need one of these. -[Joe] Yeah.
-[Rosé] Oh, my gosh. -[plays chords]
I feel more intimidated when I'm by myself.
When I'm in my room by myself,
and I go, "Should I try and write something?"
I think I'm way more intimidated then.
'Cause it's just me. I don't know if my opinions are right,
translation.ko: 저만 있어서 그래요 제 생각이 맞는지 모르니까

translation.en: and that scares me. I feel like I scare myself the most.
translation.ko: 그게 무서워요 전 제가 제일 무서운 것 같아요

translation.en: [Joe] Okay, let's record that. What's our tempo?
translation.ko: 좋아요, 그것도 녹음하죠 우리 템포가 뭐더라?

translation.en: I found these chords maybe like a month ago.
translation.ko: 한 달 전쯤에 이 코드를 찾았는데

translation.en: I was like-- I liked it. I was like, "This sounds cool."
And ever since then, I just play it.
[Joe] If anything, I was gonna put you in the booth and sing over it.
translation.ko: 로제를 부스에 넣고 불러보게 하려고 했어요

translation.en: [Rosé giggles] Okay.
Do you think I could do it? I've never tried this.
translation.ko: 제가 할 수 있을까요? 이건 안 해봤어요

translation.en: [Joe] I think you can do it. Let's just give it a try.
translation.ko: 할 수 있을 거예요 일단 한번 해보죠

translation.en: It's nice to have just the right amount of people in the room,
who are just there to accept whatever is there
and make it into something.
Joe always says, "This is the safe ground. Everything's a secret in here."
translation.ko: 조는 항상 이렇게 말해요 '여긴 안전하고 전부 비밀이에요'

translation.en: "You can make a fool out of yourself, and we won't tell anyone."
translation.ko: '바보처럼 굴어도 우린 아무한테도 말 안 해요'

translation.en: It feels just like expressing myself.
Whereas I would always sing songs of other artists.
translation.ko: 늘 다른 음악가가 만든 노래를 부르는데

translation.en: That's more like borrowing their emotions and making it mine.
translation.ko: 그게 남의 감정을 빌려서 제 것으로 만드는 일이라면

translation.en: Whereas this is totally just speaking from my point of view.
translation.ko: 이건 온전히 제 관점에서 제 이야기를 하는 거예요

translation.en: I'm almost like a baby trying to speak in the music,
translation.ko: 전 음악으로 말하려고 하는 아기와 같아요

translation.en: trying to sing… for the first time.
-[giggles] I lost it again. -[Joe] We got it.
[Jennie] Lisa, should I wear this on my way back?
translation.ko: 리사 나 돌아올 때 이거 입을까?

translation.en: [in English] BLACKPINK hoodie?
-I think you should. -[Jennie] Right?
Hello. Ah, ow! You just bit me. Coco bit me. Ah!
Coco like, "I don't care."
[Jennie in English] This year has been on the road.
This year has been pack and unpack, and unpack and pack and unpack. That's a song.
translation.ko: - 짐을 싸고 풀고 싸고 풀고 - 노래 같아

translation.en: [Jennie] At least right now, we're prepared enough to plan the resting part,
translation.ko: 적어도 지금은 휴식을 계획할 만큼 준비가 됐어요

translation.en: 'cause last year, we were just like spending time like…
And then the tour hit us,
and we're like, "Oh, my God." [Rosé] Yeah.
[Jennie in English] It was a long tour, about nine months.
[Rosé in English] When they said that we're gonna start going outside of Asia,
translation.ko: 우리가 아시아 밖으로 진출할 거란 얘기를 들었을 때

translation.en: that was like a dream.
[Rosé in English] We wanted to bring them the best show possible.
[in English] BLACKPINK, welcome to Thailand. Yay!
[Lisa in Thai] This is the first concert where BLACKPINK has been able
translation.ko: 블랙핑크가 태국 팬들을 만날 수 있는

translation.en: to meet our Thai fans.
We will do our very best and will not disappoint the BLINKS.
translation.ko: 최선을 다할게요 블링크들 실망 안 시킬게요

translation.en: [crowd chanting] BLACKPINK!
[Jennie in English] Since it was our very first world tour, it's amazing to see all these fans
translation.ko: 우리 첫 월드 투어여서 기대하지 않았던 큰 공연장들을

translation.en: filling up the big arenas that we didn't expect.
translation.ko: 가득 채운 팬들을 보니까 정말 놀라웠어요

translation.en: [Jennie in English] Once it gets going, for, like, the next 30 days,
to try to give them the best stage every day is a lot of pressure.
translation.ko: 매일 최고의 무대를 선사해야 한다는 부담감이 있어요

translation.en: [Jennie] After so many plane rides and so many environment changes,
translation.ko: 비행기를 많이 타고 환경이 자주 바뀌어서

translation.en: our body just gives up on us.
[Jennie in English] When I'm home, I like to workout and take care of my body
translation.ko: 집에 있을 땐 운동도 자주 하고 몸을 잘 돌봐요

translation.en: 'cause I'm like a grandma. I'm sick everywhere.
Honestly, I need to take care of myself.
I lose breath a little easier than other people,
and I can't jump as much as other people.
[Rosé] I think, at first, I didn't know what I was headed towards.
translation.ko: 처음에는 제가 어디로 향하는지 몰랐던 것 같아요

translation.en: [staff] Okay. Let's go.
I thought it would all be just really exciting and fun.
[Rosé in English] In the middle of it, I didn't feel like I had a personal life.
translation.ko: 그러다 제게 사생활이 없다는 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: It felt like there was this big hole in my life.
translation.ko: 제 인생에 커다란 구멍이 있는 것 같았죠

translation.en: What I'm basically living for is tomorrow's show.
I love being on stage because that's when I feel the most alive,
translation.ko: 무대에 서는 게 좋고 그때 살아있는 기분을 가장 느끼죠

translation.en: yet when we come back to the hotel, I felt so empty.
translation.ko: 그런데도 호텔로 돌아오면 너무 공허한 거예요

translation.en: [in English] Poached eggs. Ta-da!
And that's when I realized I'm homesick.
translation.ko: 그때 제가 향수병에 걸렸단 걸 알았죠

translation.en: [in English] Yeah! Let's go!
[Jennie] Lisa is the most constant one.
She brings positive energy into the group.
[Lisa in English] Sometimes I feel like…
-[Jennie in English] But it really helps. -Really?
-Yeah. -Okay.
I'll keep doing that.
-Keep going. -Yeah, keep going, Lisa! [laughs]
[Rosé] How we stay tight as a group is we try to take care of ourselves individually,
translation.ko: 그룹으로 함께 지내는 법은 각자 스스로를 잘 돌보다가

translation.en: and then come together healthy and happy so that the whole thing works.
translation.ko: 건강하고 행복하게 모이는 거예요 그래야 모든 게 잘 풀리죠

translation.en: [Jennie] Sometimes, when I look like I'm really tired and angry,
translation.ko: 제가 정말 피곤하고 화나 보일 때가 있는데

translation.en: that is my happy face.
We're all human, and we're ladies, so we have our moments.
translation.ko: 우리 다 인간이고 여자니까 우리도 힘든 순간이 있죠

translation.en: But when you have the good positive energy going on, it helps.
translation.ko: 하지만 긍정적이고 좋은 에너지가 있으면 도움이 돼요

translation.en: Los Angeles, what's up? We're BLACKPINK on 97.1 AMP radio.
translation.ko: 로스앤젤레스, 안녕 블랙핑크입니다 97.1 AMP 라디오에 나왔어요

translation.en: [radio host] You guys, the first female Korean group to perform at Coachella.
translation.ko: 여러분은 코첼라에서 공연하는 첫 한국 여자 그룹이에요

translation.en: -[all members] Oh, my gosh! -What?
[reporter] The K-pop girl band called BLACKPINK
translation.ko: "코첼라" 케이 팝 걸 그룹 블랙핑크가 이번 주말 미국에 옵니다

translation.en: is in the US this weekend.
translation.ko: 케이 팝 걸 그룹 블랙핑크가 이번 주말 미국에 옵니다

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] Because it's such a big festival,
[in English] Are we going to Coachella? BLACKPINK? Are you sure?
[in Thai] Is this for real?
[Rosé in English] I'm so excited. This is cool!
It was really nerve-wracking.
We're a group from South Korea representing our country.
[Jennie] We were just so ready to tell the world that we've been waiting for this.
translation.ko: 이걸 기다려 왔다고 세상에 말할 준비가 됐어요

translation.en: [in English] …we're gonna skip "Stay,"
and we're gonna go from "Whistle" and "Kiss and Make Up."
[Rosé in English] Usually, a BLACKPINK tour is filled with fans who come to watch us,
translation.ko: 보통 블랙핑크 투어에 오는 분들은 저희를 보러 온 팬분들인데

translation.en: but people who come to Coachella are just people who love music in general.
translation.ko: 코첼라에 온 분들은 그냥 음악을 좋아하는 분들이에요

translation.en: I personally was really worried that not many people would walk up to our show.
translation.ko: 개인적으로 저희 공연에 별로 안 오실까 봐 걱정했어요

translation.en: [Jennie] I didn't even think we would have, I don't know, 100 people or 200 people at least.
translation.ko: 몇 분 안 될 줄 알았어요 100명, 200명도 안 될 줄 알았죠

translation.en: I was just hoping to have somebody watching us.
[in English] Let's go.
-[Jennie] We can do it. -[Lisa] We can do it. It's fine.
[Lisa in Thai] I was so nervous. The moment I stepped foot on the stage
translation.ko: 무대에 발을 딱 딛는 순간 정말 많이 떨렸어요

translation.en: and saw all the crowds shouting and cheering…
[Lisa] …I got the feeling, "This is it!"
[Jennie in English] I think Coachella was the moment where I felt like
there are people that understand that this isn't just K-pop music.
translation.ko: 저희 음악이 케이 팝만은 아님을 이해하는 분들이 있단 걸요

translation.en: They see us as doing something new, and I really like that. [giggles]
translation.ko: 새로운 음악을 하는 사람들로 저희를 봐주시는 게 정말 좋아요

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] All races and all kinds of people came together there.
translation.ko: 모든 인종과 모든 부류의 사람이 코첼라에 모였어요

translation.en: So it helped emphasize…
[in English] …this represents BLACKPINK.
[Jennie in English] I'm happy to be in an era
translation.ko: 새로운 문화와 음악에 열려 있는 사람들과

translation.en: where people are open to new culture, new music.
Who would have imagined, at Coachella,
thousands of people singing in Korean… [in Korean] "Playing with fire"? [in English] What?
translation.ko: 한국어로 '불장난' 하고 노래할 줄 누가 생각이나 했겠어요?

translation.en: [Rosé in English] It doesn't matter the size of the audience.
It just matters if it's the right atmosphere.
Everybody's on the same vibe.
[Jennie in English] This was a moment where I felt really satisfied with our work.
Like all those training years were worth it!
translation.ko: 연습생 시절이 다 가치 있었다고 느껴졌죠

translation.en: [Lisa in Thai] It makes me feel that… I had chosen the right path.
This was what I really wanted to do in my life.
translation.ko: 살면서 정말 하고 싶던 일이 이거라고 느꼈죠

translation.en: [Lisa in English] We had so much fun.
I think I'll remember today for the rest of my life.
[Jennie] We love you guys!
-[Jisoo] Thank you, guys! -[Lisa] Thank you so much.
[Rosé] Goodnight!
[reporter] There's been lots of news coming from Coachella,
but one group that has everybody talking is BLACKPINK.
If you didn't know who they were before, you definitely know who they are now.
translation.ko: 블랙핑크가 누군지 몰랐던 분들도 지금은 확실히 아실 겁니다

translation.en: [in Korean] After Coachella, I think I figured out
translation.ko: "블랙핑크, 미국 첫 풀 콘서트로 코첼라를 장악하다"

translation.en: [in English] Have fun. Have fun with this.
[Lisa in Thai] It doesn't matter if we grow old
translation.ko: 우리가 늙어도 새롭고 젊은 세대에 교체돼도

translation.en: and get replaced by a new younger generation.
As long as there is still someone talking about us.
translation.ko: 우리 얘길 하는 분이 아직 있다면 괜찮아요

translation.en: Because they will still remember how we shone so bright.
translation.ko: 우리가 얼마나 밝게 빛났는지 여전히 기억하실 테니까

translation.en: ♪ Uh, I'ma fall in love, baby ♪
♪ You gon' finna catch me ♪ ♪ Uh, give you all of this, baby ♪
♪ Call me pretty and nasty ♪
♪ 'Cause we gonna get it My love you can bet it on ♪ ♪ Black, we gon' double The stack on them, whoa! ♪
♪ I'll be you Bonnie and you be my Clyde ♪
♪ We ride or die Xs and Os ♪
♪ Tonight won't you set me free… ♪
[in English] I want everybody to stand up!
[Rosé in English] We all have dreams, hunger to make it.
translation.ko: 우리 모두 꿈이 있고 성공을 갈망해요

translation.en: When you're really invested in what you do,
that's what makes things happen.
[Rosé in English] We love you, Bangkok!
Thank you so much!
[Rosé] Thank you.
Sadly, very, very extremely sadly,
Like we said before, this will be our last concert on this tour.
translation.ko: 아까 말했던 것처럼 이 콘서트가 저희 투어 마지막 콘서트예요

translation.en: And I feel like all four of us, we did really well,
translation.ko: 저희 넷 모두 정말 잘했다고 생각하고

translation.en: and I'm very proud of each and every one of us.
translation.ko: 우리 멤버 하나하나 다 정말 자랑스러워요

translation.en: -'Cause we went through a lot. -[crowd screaming]
Like, I know you guys only see the stuff that's on stage,
translation.ko: 무대 위의 저희 모습만 보시는 거 알지만

translation.en: but I feel like we all go through so much else… [voice breaks] …and I'm very proud.
translation.ko: 저희는 어려움도 많이 겪었어요 그래서 아주 대견해요

translation.en: [Rosé] During the shows, we're always looking out and talking to the audience.
translation.ko: 공연 중에는 항상 앞을 보면서 관중에게 이야기해요

translation.en: Then I was talking, and I kinda looked at my members,
and I was like, "Ah!" Then I started crying.
Because it felt like the first time talking to, you know, each.
Like, I feel like it's so hard that everybody stays away from home…
Happy tears.
-Happy tears. -Happy tears. It's okay.
[Jennie] And every time we're in Thailand, I get really emotional.
-[all giggling] -I don't know why.
-Now I'm gonna cry. I don't want to cry. -[Rosé] Everybody's gonna cry.
translation.ko: - 이제 나도 눈물 나요, 울기 싫어 - 다들 울겠어

translation.en: -[Jisoo] Everyone, cry. -[Rosé] Everyone, cry! [laughs]
So, it's like a train. It's me and then Jennie unnie.
translation.ko: 기차 같아요 제가 울면 제니 언니가 울고

translation.en: And if she cries, then Lisa cries, and then…
[in English] Thank you so much for coming. Bye! Bye.
[Jennie in English] I'm very proud of what we've created as BLACKPINK.
translation.ko: 우리가 블랙핑크로 이뤄낸 게 정말 자랑스러워요

translation.en: [Rosé] We grew into something that we didn't even know was possible.
And as much as fans are surprised with the outcome,
we are as well.
And so, it feels like a journey that they're on with us.
Bye-bye!
[Jennie] When somebody asks me, "Do you have pressure about it?"
I'm like, "No," because I feel like we're doing a great job,
translation.ko: 전 아니라고 해요 우린 잘하고 있다고 생각하고

translation.en: and we have more to show you guys. It's just the beginning.
translation.ko: 보여드릴 게 더 많거든요 이건 시작일 뿐이에요

translation.en: [Lisa in English] Thank you.
[in English] She's like, "You in Paris?" I'm like, "Don't tell me you're here."
translation.ko: 파리에 있냐고 물어보길래 설마 당신도 여기 있냐고 했죠

translation.en: It was my first time meeting her. I felt like it was my fifth time.
translation.ko: 처음 만난 사이인데 다섯 번은 본 것 같았어요

translation.en: And she said the same. Like, "Was this our first time?"
translation.ko: 할시도 같은 말을 하더라고요 '이게 우리 첫 만남이에요?'

translation.en: I'm like, "Yeah." She's just like us. She just talks like us.
translation.ko: 그래서 그렇다고 했어요 할시도 우리처럼 얘기해요

translation.en: -[Jennie] Is she from America, or… -Yeah, I think she's from LA?
[Lisa] LA! Come on, LA!
[in English] Forty three?
-[Lisa] I'm gonna be 40? -[Rosé] I'm gonna be 42.
translation.ko: - 43살에? - 난 40살 되려나? - 우리 40살 되는 거야? - 난 42살이겠네

translation.en: -[Lisa] Gonna be 40. -[Rosé] We're gonna be 42.
I feel we'll all be-- Do you think we'll all be married by then?
translation.ko: 그때쯤이면 우리 다 결혼할 것 같아?

translation.en: -[Rosé] I think we might. -Of course! It's 40… Like, come on!
[Jennie] I don't know about babies, but…
